articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Syrian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Syrian President
Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, on Sunday received a message of greeting from Bashar Al-Assad, president of the Syrian Arab Republic.
					 Extending his heartfelt congratulations to Kim Jong Un and the friendly men and officers of the Korean People's Army on the occasion of Feb. 8, its 70th birthday, Bashar Al-Assad in the message wished him bigger success and the Korean people progress and powerfulness.
					
					 The message expressed the belief that the joint efforts by the leadership of the two countries would contribute to strengthening the cooperative relations between the two countries in conformity with the wellbeing and interests of the friendly two peoples.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Mongolian FM
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Mongolian FM
Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, had a talk with D. Tsogtbaatar, minister of Foreign Affairs of Mongolia, and his party who made a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday.

articles.title: Greetings to Sri Lankan President
articles.content:
Greetings to Sri Lankan President
Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, Sunday sent a message of greeting to Maithripala Sirisena, president of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka, on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of its independence.
					 Kim in the message wished the Sri Lankan president success in his responsible work for the country's socio-political stability and economic development, expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations with a long tradition between the two countries would grow stronger in the common interests.

articles.title: Ri Su Yong Meets Mongolian FM
articles.content:
Ri Su Yong Meets Mongolian FM
Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- Ri Su Yong, member of the Political Bureau and vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the Foreign Affairs Committee of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, had a talk with D. Tsogtbaatar, minister of Foreign Affairs of Mongolia, and his party who paid a courtesy call on him on Monday.

articles.title: FM Talks between DPRK and Mongolia Held
articles.content:
FM Talks between DPRK and Mongolia Held
Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- Talks between DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Yong Ho and Mongolian Foreign Minister D. Tsogtbaatar were held at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday.
					 At the talks both sides exchanged views on the issue of continuing to develop the long-standing friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries in several fields and the issues of mutual concern and reached a consensus.
					
					 The DPRK foreign minister stressed the need to continue to develop the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries forged and developed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il with the preceding leaders of Mongolia irrespective of the changing situation.
					
					 The Mongolian foreign minister, saying that this year serves as an important occasion in developing the bilateral relations as it marks the 70th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the two countries, underlined the need to develop on good terms the Mongolia-DPRK relations of friendship with a long history and tradition.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Mongolian FM
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Mongolian FM
Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un received a gift from the Mongolian foreign minister who is on a visit to the DPRK.
					 The gift was conveyed to Kim Yong Nam, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, by D. Tsogtbaatar, minister of Foreign Affairs of Mongolia, on Monday.

articles.title: DPRK High-level Delegation to Visit S. Korea
articles.content:
DPRK High-level Delegation to Visit S. Korea
Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- A high-level delegation of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea led by Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, will soon visit south Korea to attend the opening ceremony of the 23rd Winter Olympics.

articles.title: DPRK Art Troupe Leaves
articles.content:
DPRK Art Troupe Leaves
Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- An art troupe of the DPRK led by Kwon Hyok Bong, department director of the Ministry of Culture, and Hyon Song Wol, head of the Samjiyon Orchestra, left here on Monday to give congratulatory performance for the 23rd Winter Olympics due in south Korea.
					 The art troupe will go to Wonsan by train and then visit south Korea aboard the ship "Mangyongbong-92".

articles.title: State Academic Degrees, Titles Conferred on Intellectuals
articles.content:
State Academic Degrees, Titles Conferred on Intellectuals
Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- State academic degrees and titles were conferred on intellectuals in the DPRK with due ceremony at the People's Palace of Culture on Monday ahead of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The intellectuals made signal contributions to the economic development of the country and the improvement of the people's standard of living by achieving many successes in the struggle to solve all problems arising in the building of a powerful socialist country by dint of science and technology.
					
					 The title of academician went to Ri Sung Ik, a researcher at Pyongyang Medical College of Kim Il Sung University, and the title of candidate academician to teachers Ri Myong Il and Ho Tal Yun and researcher Sin Thae Gyong of Kim Il Sung University, Pak Man Song, a researcher at the Farm Machine Institute of the Ministry of Agriculture, and others.
					
					 Professorship was conferred on department heads Won Chol Guk and Ri Tong Yun, teacher Ro Sung Il and section chief Ri Song Ho of Kim Il Sung University, deans of faculties Han Hyon Il and Pak Ki Chang and Director of an institute Paek Un Yong of Kim Chaek University of Technology, Kim Sok Bong, head of a department of Pyongyang University of Architecture, Kim Hye Gwon, vice-rector of Korea University of Physical Education, O Yu Song, section chief of the State Academy of Sciences, Mun Jong Ji, vice-rector of College of Education No. 2 of Phyongbuk University, and Won Ye Yon, a teacher of Hamhung University of Chemical Engineering.
					
					 Doctorate went to Kum Chol Ryong and Ri Hyok Chol, department heads of Kim Il Sung University, Ra Jin Myong, an academic adviser to Pyongyang Medical College of Kim Il Sung University, Ra Yong Chol and Hyon Pyol I, department heads of Kim Chaek University of Technology, Kim Pyong Uk, a teacher of Pyongyang University of Foreign Studies, and others, associate professorship to 160 persons and master's degree to 1,082 persons.

articles.title: Japan Police's Search of Tokyo Metropolitan Headquarters of Chongryon under Fire
articles.content:
Japan Police's Search of Tokyo Metropolitan Headquarters of Chongryon under Fire
Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- A combined investigation headquarters of the Metropolitan Police Office and the Saitama Prefectural Police of Japan conducted a search of the Tokyo Metropolitan Headquarters of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) on Feb. 1.
					 That day 100-odd armed policemen and police vehicles including three large buses encircled the Tokyo Metropolitan Headquarters and the combined investigation headquarters carried out an exhaustive search of the headquarters despite the protest of Chongryon officials.
					
					 What should not be overlooked is the fact that the Japanese authorities are trying to stir up the anti-Chongryon atmosphere, building up public opinion over this case through media.
					
					 Officials of Chongryon and its affiliated organizations and Tokyo Metropolitan Headquarters, members of the Korean Youth League and other Korean residents in Japan staged a strong protest outside the office of the Tokyo Metropolitan Headquarters, holding slogan boards and placards reading "We denounce the Japanese police authorities' unwarranted oppression of Chongryon".

articles.title: Appeal of Joint Conference of DPRK Supported by Koreans in China
articles.content:
Appeal of Joint Conference of DPRK Supported by Koreans in China
Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China issued a statement on Jan. 30 in support of the appeal to all the Koreans at home and abroad adopted at the joint conference of the DPRK government, political parties and organizations.
					 The statement said that the officials of the general association and all Koreans in China would devote all their enthusiasm and wisdom to glorifying this year as a year of events to be specially recorded in the national history, in response to the appeal.
					
					 It said that they would hold in high esteem respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un as the great lodestar of national reunification and positively support his idea and line of independent reunification with warm patriotism.
					
					 It stressed that they would turn out as one in the struggle for glorifying this year as the year of a great turn and event to be eternally recorded in the history of national reunification.
					
					 Cha Sang Bo, vice-chairman of the general association, spokespersons for the Zhongnan Regional Association of the general association, the Association of Young Koreans in China and the Association of Korean Women in China, issued statements in support of the above-said appeal.

articles.title: Oath-taking Meeting of Youth League Officials
articles.content:
Oath-taking Meeting of Youth League Officials
Samjiyon, February 5 (KCNA) -- Youth league officials from across the country met at leader Kim Jong Il's birthplace in the Paektusan Secret Camp Monday on the occasion of his birth anniversary to vow to accelerate the final victory in the revolutionary cause of Juche under the guidance of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					 Attending the meeting were officials concerned and the study tour makers of youth league officials from across the country.
					
					 Led by Pak Chol Min, first secretary of the C.C., Kimilsungist-Kimjongilist Youth League, the participants pledged to remain faithful to the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 They expressed the resolve to hold in high esteem President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il as the eternal sun of Juche and build up the youth league into the Kimilsungist-Kimjongilist youth league forever.
					
					 All of them also made a pledge to give full play to the heroic stamina and wisdom of the Korean youth in the struggle for hastening the final victory in the building of a powerful socialist country.
					
					 At the end of the meeting they went round historic mementoes preserved at the birthplace.

articles.title: People Visit Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum
articles.content:
People Visit Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum
Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- A constant stream of people visits the regular armed forces building wing of the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum on the occasion of the 70th birthday of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					 The wing deals with the feats President Kim Il Sung performed in strengthening the Korean People's Revolutionary Army into the regular revolutionary armed forces KPA and laying a foundation for the self-supporting munitions industry.
					
					 Among the visitors this year alone were service personnel and working people and youth and students of many units including Kim Il Sung University and the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex.
					
					 The visitors went round historic data and mementoes showing that the President set up the Security Officers Training Centre and led the work for building a regular army with modern services, arms and corps.
					
					 They also looked round a photo of Kim Il Sung declaring the birth of regular revolutionary armed forces on the platform of military parade on Feb. 8, 1948 and the mike used by him and the colors raised by the military parade ranks.
					
					 And they went round the submachine guns he awarded anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters and weapons of various kinds produced by the Korean working people for the first time and data showing the strong spirit of the servicepersons.

articles.title: Taedoksan Post
articles.content:
Taedoksan Post
Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- It has been 55 years since President Kim Il Sung set forth the slogan "A-Match-for-a-Hundred," when visiting the Taedoksan frontline post together with leader Kim Jong Il on February 6, Juche 52 (1963).
					 That day, the President acquainted himself in detail with the military service of servicepersons at the post and said that a general well-versed in battle has been called a-match-for-a-hundred combatant from olden times.
					
					 He also put forward the task and ways to train them politically, ideologically and in military technique and set forth the slogan "A-Match-for-a-Hundred" to be adhered to by the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					
					 Bearing the intention of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in their mind, servicepersons at the post have prepared themselves to be "A-Match-for-a-Hundred" combatants.
					
					 And the enthusiasm for military and political training started at the Taedoksan post, the native place of the slogan, has prevailed over the whole army to be conducive to strengthening the KPA into an invincible one.
					
					 Now the KPA is demonstrating its might as the invincible revolutionary armed forces fully possessed of actual war capability and equipped with the strongest military muscle in the world under the guidance of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un who is successfully giving continuity to the history and tradition of "A-Match-for-a-Hundred" pioneered by the peerlessly great men.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Traits of Korean People Living for Tomorrow
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Traits of Korean People Living for Tomorrow
Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- The Korean people devote themselves to the work for rosy future of the country despite the grim tempest of history, Rodong Sinmun Monday says in an article.
					 The article goes on:
					
					 The revolutionary traits of the Korean people living for tomorrow is manifested in the fact that they are staunchly advancing along the road of socialism. They devotedly work at their revolutionary posts to make everything flawless even in the distant future.
					
					 Now the Korean people vigorously push forward the all-out revolutionary offensive to achieve a fresh victory on all fronts of building a powerful socialist country.
					
					 They have turned out in the charge for increased production and creation, with the single mind to devote themselves to the future.
					
					 The hostile forces are now getting evermore vicious in their challenges, but nothing can block the advance of the revolutionary people possessed of the noble view of life to live for tomorrow.
					
					 All our party members, servicepersons and working people will make uninterrupted innovations and progress to build as early as possible a socialist fairyland, the best powerful and prosperous country where the people enjoy a happy life to the full with nothing to envy in the world.

articles.title: U.S. Blasted for Marring Atmosphere of Improved Inter-Korean Ties
articles.content:
U.S. Blasted for Marring Atmosphere of Improved Inter-Korean Ties
Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- The U.S. has recently tried hard to drive the situation on the Korean Peninsula into confrontation again by marring the atmosphere for detente and improvement of the inter-Korean relations created thanks to the patriotic and proactive efforts of the DPRK.
					 Commenting on the fact, Rodong Sinmun Monday says it shows that the U.S., upset by the hard-won climate of national reconciliation and unity and the improvement of the inter-Korean ties on the peninsula, is making desperate efforts to prevent the trend at any cost.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The U.S. claims to "back" the inter-Korean dialogue, but it is nothing but an artifice to cover up its sinister intention to persistently coil up the tension on the peninsula.
					
					 Such criminal act is a dangerous scheme to start a war for aggression on the DPRK.
					
					 Watching the Trump group seek to hinder the inter-Korean dialogue and openly aggravate the situation, the Korean nation and the international community clearly see once again through the black-hearted intention of the U.S., harasser of dialogue and peace and nuclear war maniac.
					
					 The reality proves that so long as the U.S. persists in its sinister scheme and anti-reunification interference, it is impossible to expect smooth development of the inter-Korean ties and achieve the peace and stability of the peninsula.

articles.title: Investigation into Sexual Abuses in Prosecution Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Investigation into Sexual Abuses in Prosecution Demanded in S. Korea
Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- The Citizens Solidarity for Democratic Society of south Korea issued a statement on Jan. 31 in demand of an investigation into the sexual abuses in the prosecution.
					 Noting that a woman prosecutor disclosed the situation of sexual abuses in the prosecution, the statement stressed that overall investigation into the Ministry of Justice and the prosecution is necessary.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Russia
Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for marking the 76th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il was formed by the Maritime Territorial Regional Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation on Jan. 24.
					 Its First Secretary Dolgachev was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee set a celebration period from Jan. 25 to Feb. 16 and decided to give wide publicity to the feats of Kim Jong Il through media and hold colorful political and cultural events in the period.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Marked by Political Parties and Bodies under CPSU
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Marked by Political Parties and Bodies under CPSU
Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- A joint preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (Day of the Shining Star) was formed by the political parties and bodies under the Communist Party of Soviet Union on Jan. 24.
					 The preparatory committee with Mozgovoy, first secretary of the C.C., Communist Party of Soviet Union and chairman of International Social Federation "for the Union and Union's Communist Party", as its chairman consists of figures of the Communist Party of Kyrgyzstan, the Communist Workers Party of Russia, the Communist Workers' Party of Belarus, Communist Party of Azerbaijan, the Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK, and other parties and organizations.
					
					 It decided to hold political and cultural events in praise of the revolutionary career and feats of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: DPRK Sure to Win in Standoff with U.S.: Benin Bodies
articles.content:
DPRK Sure to Win in Standoff with U.S.: Benin Bodies
Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- The Benin-Korea Amicable Association "Long Live Kim Jong Il, Supreme Leader" and the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea on Jan. 29 made public a joint statement ahead of the 70th founding anniversary of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					 The statement said that President Kim Il Sung set the founding of a regular army as an essential requirement of the building of an independent and sovereign state and founded the KPA, the revolutionary regular armed forces, with his outstanding idea of army building and energetic leadership.
					
					 The accomplishment of the cause of building the regular armed forces enabled the Korean army and people to win in the three-year Fatherland Liberation War and build a powerful socialist country independent in politics, self-supporting in the economy and self-reliant in defence, it added.
					
					 The statement noted that respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un has further strengthened the KPA into the invincible revolutionary ranks by consolidating its politico-military might in every way.
					
					 Under his guidance the Korean army and people will defend the country's sovereignty and dignity and surely win in the anti-imperialist and anti-U.S. confrontation struggle, it stressed.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con D. Tsogtbaatar y su comitiva
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con D. Tsogtbaatar y su comitiva
Pyongyang, 5 de febrero (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, se reunio el dia 5 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores de Mongolia, D. Tsogtbaatar, y su comitiva, quien le hicieron una visita de cortesia.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Sri Lanka
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Sri Lanka
Pyongyang, 5 de febrero (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, remitio ayer un mensaje de felicitacion a Maithripala Sirisena, presidente de la Republica Democratica Socialista de Sri Lanka, en ocasion del septuagesimo aniversario de la independencia de ese pais asiatico.
					En su misiva, el remitente formulo votos por los exitos en las responsabilidades del destinatario por lograr la estabilidad sociopolitica y el desarrollo economico del pais y expuso su seguridad de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre la RPDC y Sri Lanka de largas tradiciones se intensificaran y se desarrollaran mas de acuerdo con los intereses comunes.

articles.title: Ri Su Yong se reune con ministro de Relaciones Exteriores de Mongolia y su comitiva
articles.content:
Ri Su Yong se reune con ministro de Relaciones Exteriores de Mongolia y su comitiva
Pyongyang, 5 de febrero (ACNC) -- Ri Su Yong, miembro del Buro Politico y vicepresidente del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y presidente de la Comision de Relaciones Exteriores de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, departio el dia 5 con D. Tsogtbaatar, ministro de Relaciones Exteriores de Mongolia, y su comitiva, que realizaron una visita de cortesia.

articles.title: Delegacion de alto nivel de la RPDC visitara el Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Delegacion de alto nivel de la RPDC visitara el Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 5 de febrero (ACNC) -- La delegacion de alto nivel de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea encabezada por Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC, visitara pronto el Sur de Corea para participar en el acto inaugural de los XXIII Juegos Olimpicos Invernales.

articles.title: Parte de Pyongyang el conjunto artistico de la RPDC
articles.content:
Parte de Pyongyang el conjunto artistico de la RPDC
Pyongyang, 5 de febrero (ACNC) -- El conjunto artistico de la RPDC que dirigen Kwon Hyok Bong, jefe de departamento del Ministro de Cultura, y Hyon Song Wol, jefa de ka Orquesta Samjiyon, partio el dia 5 de esta capital para felicitar los 23o Juegos Olimpicos Invernales.
					El conjunto artistico llegara a Wonsan en el tren y visitara en el barco "Mangyongbon-92" el Sur de Corea.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun condena los actos criminales de EE.UU.
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun condena los actos criminales de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 5 de febrero (ACNC) -- Estos dias, EE.UU. maniobra siniestramente para romper el ambiente por la distension y la mejora de relaciones entre el Norte y el Sur de Corea, creado en la Peninsula Coreana por los esfuerzos activos y patrioticos de la RPDC, y llevar la situacion a la fase conflictiva.
					Esto comprueba que EE.UU. esta aturdido ante el ambiente por la reconciliacion y unidad nacionales y la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas, preparado a duras penas en la Peninsula Coreana, y se vale de todos los medios para impedirlo.
					
					Asi insiste el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual divulgado el dia 5 y continua:
					
					EE.UU. expresa el "apoyo" al dialogo Norte-Sur, pero esto no pasa de ser una artimana para encubrir su intencion malsana de seguir agravando la tension de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Tales actos criminales de EE.UU. devienen una aventura peligrosa para encender la mecha de la guerra de agresion contra la RPDC.
					
					Presenciando las maniobras de la banda de Trump para impedir el dialogo Norte-Sur y exacerbar la tension, la nacion coreana y la sociedad internacional se percatan claramente de la faz verdadera de EE.UU. como destructor de dialogo y paz y maniaco de guerra nuclear.
					
					La realidad muestra que no se puede esperar un desarrollo normal de relaciones intercoreanas ni lograr la paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana mientras que continuen la intencion malsana y la intervencion de EE.UU. en la reunificacion de Corea.
